title: PM directs for timely completion of water reservoirs
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jan 20 (APP):Prime Minister Imran Khan Thursday directed officials to complete the ongoing water reservoir projects within the stipulated time.
He said it was very important to timely complete the projects of water reservoirs for maintaining the countryâ€™s food security.
The Prime Minister was chairing the review meeting here on a coordinated strategy to improve the system of irrigation in the country.
The meeting was briefed, on a sustainable and durable system for equitable distribution of water in the provinces, strategy for supplying canal water to the agricultural lands without wastage, an effective system for stopping theft of water and on projects to make barren lands cultivable by expanding the system of irrigation.
The participants were told that for the first time in the history of the country, the present government was ensuring implementation of the projects of storing river water and this decade was named as the decade of dams.
Besides, steps were taken to stop theft of water in the provinces of Punjab and Khyber Pakhtunkhwa.
Further, it was told that under the vision of prime minister for giving priority to food security, the government was working on implementation of the agricultural transformation plan.
Advisor to Prime Minister for National Security Dr Moeed Yusuf, Vice Chairman Planning Commission and high level officers attended the meeting.
Chief Minister Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Mehmood Khan and provincial officers were also present in the meeting through video link.
